The 'Canton of Bern' (, ; ) is the second largest of the 26 Swiss cantons by
both surface area and population. Located in west-central Switzerland, it
borders the Canton of Jura and the Canton of Solothurn to the north. To the west
lie the Canton of NeuchÃ¢tel, the Canton of Fribourg and Vaud. To the south lies
the Valais. East of the canton of Bern lie the cantons of Uri, Nidwalden,
Obwalden, Lucerne and Aargau.

The canton of Bern is bilingual and has a population (as of ) of . , the
population included 119,930 (or 12.45%) foreigners. The cantonal
capital, also the federal capital of Switzerland, is Bern.
